events.name: The state of research in ASEAN: Co-publication and co-patenting activity
events.description:
Southeast Asia has more than doubled its share of the world's research publication output over the last decade. Patenting activity also increased significantly: The number of annual international patent applications involving ASEAN-based inventors has tripled from the early 2000s to the early 2010s.  
A research team of the EU-funded SEA-EU-NET project carried out a study assessing the research output in ASEAN Member States in the period 2000 to 2014. The lead author of the study, Alexander Degelsegger, Centre for Social Innovation, Austria will present the key findings and identify the public policy measures behind them.               
This seminar will be of interest to anyone interested in a comparative analysis of scientific output and patenting activities of the ten ASEAN countries and the role of international collaboration therein. 
This event is kindly supported by the National Research Foundation of Singapore.
events.location: NRF Create Tower, University Town, 1 Create Way, Singapore null
events.group_name: EURAXESS ASEAN together with S&T Diplomatic Circle Singapore

events.name: #IoTIsCollaboration­ - An Integrated Approach (IoT Asia 2017 Techspace)
events.description:
As a part of our efforts to support the IoTEcosystem, we will be hosting our next session at IoTAsia 2017 Techspace. #IoTIsCollaboration - An Integrated Approach IoT projects are  not just about technologies, but rather should be an integrated approach from different business units of an organization, technology providers, and customers. A connected solutions approach to create a value. In this session we will lean from the industry experts on how they accelerate their IoT journey in more collaborative manner. Several case studies will be shared. We will have three speakers to cover the end to end approach, from business, solutions architecture and advanced tech e.g. AI, ML in IoT. 


 **************************************************************** Date: 30th March, 4-6pm at Techspace at IoT Asia 2017 Details at: http://www.internetofthingsasia.com/techspace *****************************************************************  This is a free session, however you would need to signup at IoTAsia to gain entry in the exhibition. Visit http://www.internetofthingsasia.com for online conference delegate and exhibition visitor registration!  If you would like to attend the conference, you can enjoy 15% discount as IoTSG members.  ***************************************************************** Note: Please note that photography and videography will be carried out throughout the event.  IoT SG, Event Sponsors, Supporters may use some or all of these images in its print publications, digital, social platforms and/or marketing channels. We also ask some personal information and questions during registration. This data is used to do further due diligence to improve the quality of events. This data may also be shared with sponsoring organisations, speakers to help them to collaborate more efficiently. We do not sell your data.

events.name: Evolutionary Architecture with Patrick Kua
events.description: In our industry, one of the only guarantees is change. Many of today’s tools, technologies, and business models will soon cease to exist, only to be replaced by newer ones. Architects face the challenge of planning for today’s systems knowing that the problems of tomorrow will be completely different from the problems of today. Evolutionary architecture is an architectural approach that prioritizes change as a first principle but balances this need with delivering value early. Architects who adopt evolutionary architecture approaches make better choices that enable future change. Patrick Kua explains what evolutionary architecture is and why it’s important. Patrick examines some well-known architectural styles, looking at how well they adapt to change and fit the characteristics of evolutionary architecture, before outlining the principles that guide architectural and design decisions and concrete practices to help teams build systems that can evolve over time.
events.location: ThoughtWorks , 18 cross street #11-08 China Sq Central (S)048423, Singapore

events.name: Financing Your Startup
events.description:
Sign up for free here: bit.ly/2mlT8wR

Speakers:
Tiang Lim Foo (Operating Partner, Seedplus)
Roshni Mahtani (CEO and Founder of Tickled Media)
Martin Tang (Vice President, Venture Growth Partners Company, DBS Bank. Living, Breathing Asia)
Benny Chan (Executive Director of Group Channels and Digitalisation, UOB)


What is seed and venture capital? What is the current state of the market? Who invests in startups? How do startups best prepare for funding? What are some useful resources, tips and tricks? Do you already have an idea or are working on a startup, and are ready to raise capital?

We get it if you're completely lost on which method to choose, so we have assembled a panel of funders to give you the lowdown on the world of startup financing. This talk will provide founders with a practical understanding of the essential things to know in order to navigate through the early stage of a company's existence and raising capital and give perspectives from various methods of raising finance such as through an accelerator, venture capital/debt or angel investments.

Be prepared to ask questions! Drinks & networking will follow. This session will be moderated by Aziza Sheerin 
(Regional Director, Singapore, General Assembly).

This panel discussion is held in conjunction with NTUC U Startup Day.
events.location: NTUC Auditorium @ Level 7, One Marina Boulevard, , Singapore

events.name: GTT0317:  The Future Shape of Android Development
events.description:
Introduction: Android development is growing fast, the modern state of tools and approaches is evolving and changing. RxJava2, DataBinding and Kotlin all those came into play not so long ago and going to be a big thing sooner. Talks will be accessible to all levels: we welcome beginner and engineers who already have an experience with those topics on Thursday 30th March 2017.  Presenter Profile:  


Stepan Goncharov is the lead Android Engineer at 90 Seconds, Main contributor of RxKotlinm and RxDatabindings author. Besides, he is also technical blogger, OSS lover and Kotlin addict. Leading teams, creating products, engineering Android Apps and games since 2008. Stepan is also Gym rat, PS4 player and wakeboarder in spare time. 


 


Ilya Vorobev, an Android developer with 5 years experience, helps musicians to create and get inspiration by developing the Bandlab android app. He believes that developers do a very significant impact on business growth. Ilya is also keen on mobile technologies, VR, data science and game development. 

 


Andrey Mischenko is the Android lead at BandLab. Kotlin Coroutines for Retrofit author. He Has been working as an Android developer for the last five years, the two of them for BandLab and the last year with Kotlin. Andrey became mobile development from full stack web development, and continued to work on social and messaging services for Android.  Format: Three (3) short Presentations and a demo followed by ~20 minutes of audience Q&A for a total of ~one and a half (1.5) hours.  Agenda: Our agenda for the evening should be as follows: • 7:00pm - Registration opens • 7:10pm - Happy Hour Networking with Bites • 7:20pm - Welcome Remarks & Presenter Introductions • 7:30pm - Stepan Goncharov on  • Short intro to rxJava 2 tips and tricks • 8:00pm - Illya Vorobev on  • Facilitate your company's growth with MVVM and Data Binding • 8:30pm - Andrey Mischenko on  Kotlin: A New Hope? • 9:00pm - Audience Q&A • 9:30pm - More Drinks, Bites & Networking • 10:00pm - The End  Note Please RSVP here first and tell us your dietary restrictions if any, so that we can better prepare the food and drinks for optimal merry making.  About Grab Tech Thursdays: Grab Tech Thursdays is a monthly series for peers in Asia's tech startup community to share knowledge and best practices as well as provide an informal space to network. Originally conceived within Grab to focus on pushing the boundaries of technology and business to Drive Southeast Asia Forward, we are excited to now make available these sessions on the last Thursday of each month to the wider tech/startup community. Stay tuned and check back for our line-up of interesting speakers and content.
events.location: Grab, 138 Cecil Street, #01-01 Cecil Court, Singapore 069538
